channel.title: New Zealand Programming Contest
channel.description: Recent content on New Zealand Programming Contest

item.title: Contest sites
item.description: Site details for the latest contest are listed below. Use the URL to find out details, or email the site director. SiteHostSite DirectorExternal URL Auckland University of Auckland Miao Qiao Auckland External Page Hamilton University of Waikato Tom Levy Hamilton External Page Invercargill Southern Institute of Technology Ken Sutton Invercargill External Page Christchurch University of Canterbury Richard Lobb Christchurch External Page Wellington Whitireia New Zealand Adrian Hargreaves Not available at the moment.

item.title: Contest categories
item.description: Notes If team members are not in the same category, then the team must enter in the highest category of the members. Entry fees do NOT apply for an on-line contest. Category Description Entry Fee School Team members must all attend a secondary school in New Zealand. This includes a home school. $30 Tertiary Junior Usually first year university students. Have not started any second year papers. $75 Tertiary Intermediate Usually second year university students.

item.title: Contest registration
item.description: Team registration will again be done through DOMjudge on contest day. You will be able to reserve places for your teams through this website from mid-August. Contest Documentation Contest Rules Registration Guide - School Teams Registration Guide - Tertiary Teams Registration Guide - Open Category Teams

item.title: About the contest
item.description: The NZPC is an annual contest, usually held in September, and open to all programmers in New Zealand. Teams from outside New Zealand may enter the ANZAC League which runs at the same time and uses the same problem set. Categories There are 5 categories under which teams may compete, each category having its own winner. The categories range from school pupils to professional programmers. Category Details Sites Teams must compete at one of the official sites, although we will be flexible if any part of New Zealand is in lockdown.

item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest 2021 Results
item.description: The contest this year was held entirely online because of the outbreak of the Delta Variant of Covid-19. Category Winners Scoreboard School Steve++, Burnside High School - team School Scoreboard Tertiary Junior Coding Coconuts, Victoria University of Wellington - team Tertiary Junior Scoreboard Tertiary Intermediate SE2 Noobies, University of Auckland - team Tertiary Intermediate Scoreboard Tertiary Open Trie-O, University of Auckland - team Tertiary Open Scoreboard Open YS, Independent - team Open Scoreboard Contest Problems

item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest 2022 Results
item.description: After 2 years of online contests, this year we were back on site. Category Winners Scoreboard School Syzygy, Mt Albert Grammar School - team School Scoreboard Tertiary Junior The Lobb Fan Club, University of Canterbury - team Tertiary Junior Scoreboard Tertiary Intermediate CAJ, University of Canterbury - team Tertiary Intermediate Scoreboard Tertiary Open cflat, University of Canterbury - team Tertiary Open Scoreboard Open Griffin, Independent - team Open Scoreboard Contest Problems
